instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Before removing the motherboard I could see 20V and 2.80Ampere current. Continues to chime sound (Not very loud) when I open the lid. Sometimes (I think after SMC reset) I can see an apple logo coming and going without backlight.

I have removed the logic board the current/power consumption is 20V and 0.44Ampere (8.83W).
Here are the voltages 
L3500 - P5VUSBC_X_R  - 0V
L8410 - PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT -0V
L7030 - PPBUS_G3H - 13.11V
L7660 - PP3V3_S5 - 3.367V
C7651 -  PP5V_S5 - 5.150  
L7600 - PP5V_S4 - 5.153V
L7700 - PPVCCEDRAM_S0_REG_F - 1.056
L7430 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V
L7420 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V
L7410 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V

L7210 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0.629V
L7220 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0.629V
L7270 - PPVCCSA_S0_CPU - 0.897V


L8000 - PP1V0_SUS - 1.028V
L7960 - PPVCCIO_S0_CPU - 0.959V
L7900 - PP1V2_S3 - 1.206V
L8050 - PPVCCPRIMCORE_SUS_PCH - 1.013V

Could someone please give me some advice on how to proceed further to diagnose and fix the issue?
History of this board: As far as I know someone changed the display, Maybe some nonprofessional person. This issue started from there, 

Thanks in advance 
Br
Manu

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
0.629V on VCORE looks good.
Disconnect internal LCD and test with external monitor only.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I have removed the LVDS cable from the internal display and tested it with an external monitor. After a lot of attempts, I could see an apple logo on the monitor for just 2 seconds, immediately it restarted. I think the HDMI needs some time for detecting it, before that it is restarting. The fans are not running while pressing the power button. Same time the CPU heat pipe also warm (Not too hot approximately 50 deg).

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Disconnect Touch ID and test again.

If battery is charging, test the board on battery alone, without charger.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I have removed J4402 connector and the charger. It still has the same problem... continues chime and no sound.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: J4900 is Touch ID connector.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I have removed  J4900 , It still has the same problem.  Continues chime sound, Fan not running

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
You should check for knocked of components; near the screw holes.
Also inspect all connectors for damage.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
No, i don't see anything unusual near the screw holes, except the C8410 and C8412 caps broken, C8410 I have already replaced.Apart from that J6951 clip is broken, But still, there is proper contact on the pins. I don't think it is creating the problem. 
Is there anything else I can try on this board?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Check if battery is charging.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I can see it is charger is supplying 2.80Ampere current when I connect the battery. Is there any other option I can make sure the battery is charging ?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Monitor PPBUS_G3H voltage; it should slowly increase, when charges battery.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Yes  voltage at PPBUS_G3H is slightly increasing when I connect the charger, It was 12.2V then went up to 12.6V and increasing further

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Then J6951 has good contacts.

As you already found some broken components, inspect entire board under microscope.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I have inspected the entire board couldn't find anything suspicious, I don't know how to proceed now.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
"PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0.629V"
Is it stable, or fluctuates with each chime sound?

Try starting in SMC bypass, to see if board stays on.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Back to this board ,  PPVCC_S0_CPU   is stable , I don't see fluctuation on any of the rails
L3500 - P5VUSBC_X_R - 0V
L8410 - PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT -0V
L7030 - PPBUS_G3H - 13.11V
L7660 - PP3V3_S5 - 3.367V
C7651 - PP5V_S5 - 5.150
L7600 - PP5V_S4 - 5.153V
L7700 - PPVCCEDRAM_S0_REG_F - 1.056
L7430 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V
L7420 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V
L7410 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V

L7210 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0.629V
L7220 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 0.629V
L7270 - PPVCCSA_S0_CPU - 0.897V


L8000 - PP1V0_SUS - 1.028V
L7960 - PPVCCIO_S0_CPU - 0.959V
L7900 - PP1V2_S3 - 1.206V
L8050 - PPVCCPRIMCORE_SUS_PCH - 1.013V

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Did you test without battery, nor trackpad flex connected?
In fact disconnect internal LCD and check with external monitor only.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
L7430 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V
L7420 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V
L7410 - PPVCCGT_S0_CPU - 0V 

Isn't these voltages are not necessary?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
NO, until high graphics load is detected.
May appear with external monitor connected, just check.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Just out of curiosity, [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/a1706-emc3163-touch-bar-not-working-after-display-replacement.61221/page-2#post-76380[/URL]   >>>> In this case also the same rails were missing, How did you conclude that it is a dead CPU?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: The other board had have an overvoltage caused by CPU power supply!!!

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Removing J501 I could see the fans running, starting with low speed and keep increasing to high speed, No other difference.Battery connectors also removed, Doesn't made any change.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Is there anything else I can try in this board?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
BUF_SMC_RESET_L steady high?
Also check SMC_LSOC_RST_L.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Shall I remove the board separately and check it ? Or with the display and enclosure connected?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Test it when it chimes in loop.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Sad news is it stopped Chim . I don't know what happened?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
SMC_LSOC_RST_L stays high (3.9V).
BUF_SMC_RESET_L  - This I couldn't measure Because the test points are located on bottom layer where I don't have access when the board is mounted

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Yes now its started chimming again , Even while chime  SMC_LSOC_RST_L stays high (3.9V).  BUF_SMC_RESET_L   couldn't monitor

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is 44V but not back light

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I think the backlight is there but no image, So I couldn't realize that

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Let me elaborate a little more , 

When I power up its goes to two different scenarios 
Scenario1-  it goes to loop with a chime sound. When it is in the loop I can see there is the backlight. 
Scenario 2 - When I try to start No backlight, Slowly CPU heat increasing and the fan works after some time.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Could someone please advise me on how to proceed?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Check CPU core voltage in both scenarios.
Disconnect devices one by one and try to identify if boots, but not looping.

Did you try PRAM reset?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Scenario1 - Loop
L7210 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.078V
L7220 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.078V 

Scenario 2 - No response
L7210 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.049V
L7220 - PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.049V

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: PRAM reset doesn't help

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
One more input - I have a strong feeling that scenario 1 and scenario2 are related to temperature. If the heatsink is hot it doesn't go to loop. Or else it goes to loop.

Regarding the PRAM reset - I could hear only one chime when I press all four keys, Keep waiting for the second chime but it's not happening. But I could feel the heat on the heatsink.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Check for USB activity, when the board doesn't loop.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Hi, In USB what activity should I monitor? Can you tell me the net names?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
You can get requested info here...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Just tried this method ,  [U]Start the built-in AHT:[/U]  This is worked ,,,,,, I could see the wifi selection window on internal screen ,,,,

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Hi, 
After updating with a clean working image Scenario1 is not occurring at all, I mean not chiming or not going to loop.
I think it's directly going to Scenario 2. 
Should I put back the old bios image or I should check something else with this bios image?
Scenario1- it goes to loop with a chime sound. When it is in the loop I can see there is the backlight.
Scenario 2 - When I try to start No backlight, Slowly CPU heat increasing.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: USB activity present on scenario 2?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I am not sure, I have a medusa 3, But i don't have a chipmunk USB tester, Is there something I can try with medusa 3?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Connect a macOS installer with LED Link; can be a SSD to USB adapter.
If LED flashes, then you have USB activity.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Let me explain what I have tried , 
Connected a type C to Usb 3 adapter from Usb 3 connected another USB 3 to SATA converter, then an HHD with Macintosh HD image. 

I could see one LED out of two is glowing.

 [URL]https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1-YwY_Hc1qlF4fXoRUzoCUaQEaf1sXhkR[/URL]

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
One LED is for power ; steady light as normal.
The other one MUST flash when boots; denotes data transfer/reading.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: I can hear HDD running sound, sometimes the first LED is flashing, Maybe it's trying to boot... But not happening. I have just seen an apple logo for a moment. But not the boot loading bar.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Seems to be looping still.

Did you flash full BIOS, or just clean ME region with Medusa?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Yes, I have flashed the full bios, With full bios flashing I don't see Scenario1 anymore...

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Try another BIOS file, just in case; known good one, if possible.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Is there any chance someone can help me with other working bios?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Even this bios didn’t help, Not going to loop,,,  and not booting… Some times I can see backlight

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: Is there anything else I can try on this board? To be honest, don't want to scrap such an expensive board ...:cry:

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: You can't get wifi selection window anymore?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message: When I got a working image I have programmed the flash image, The system doesn't give a wifi selection window... Just it not booting and not going to boot recovery window

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Looks like something on the board reacted to the heat.
You can try to heat BGA chips with quality flux.

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
Yes I agree with you it has something to do with heat
example ..... 
When I power up its goes to two different scenarios
Scenario1- it goes to loop with a chime sound. When it is in the loop I can see the backlight. Just before going to loop it shows the apple logo, Apple logo shows only if i start with a pram reset or else direct loop...
Scenario 2 - When I try to start No backlight, Slowly CPU heat increasing and the fan works after some time. 

Now the scenario 1 occurs only if I start when the CPU is fully cold. 
If I start CPU warm condition it goes to Scenario 2...

Very strange behavior .... Apparently it's not the problem with bios

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:

threads.message: CPU as first...

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:

CPU as first...

To be honest, the board looks new, There is no chance of corrosion, Should I really do the BGA heating? Would be related to some sensor?

threads.title: 820-00239-09 - A1706 continues chime sound
threads.message:
You may have broken trace, or solders.
Something reacted to heat for sure...
